definitions.definition: To change sides; to cross over to work for the opposition.
definitions.example: You argued well in court but your firm doesn't pay its lawyers well, so why don't you come across to ours?

definitions.definition: To give an appearance or impression; to project a certain image.
definitions.example: A business suit and briefcase help her to come across as the competent professional she is.
In the meadow he came across a rare flower.

definitions.definition: To produce what was desired; come up with the goods.
